qas.question: What do orthodox Jews express ambivalence towards?
What is the administration of the state of Isreal seen as?
What does the State of Isreal place emphasis on besides Militarism?
What does the State of Isreal place emphasis on in addition to Nationalism?
what is the Zionist administrartion of the state of Israel seen as according to the judaic way of life?
Who is not ambivalent toward Zionism?

plausible_answers.text: Orthodox Judaism, Haredi Orthodox and Hasidic Orthodox Jews

qas.question: Which groups of Orthodox Jews are outspokenly pro-Zionistic?
What ideology do many Orthodox Jews see as in support of the Torah?
What do Orthodox Jews see as a benefit to the Judaic way of life?
Who is in charge of the Zionist administration?

context: Politically, <b5_0>Orthodox Jews<b5_0/>, given their variety of movements and affiliations, tend not to conform easily to the standard left-right political spectrum, with one of the key differences between the movements stemming from the groups' attitudes to Zionism. Generally speaking, of the three key strands of <b6_0>Orthodox Judaism, Haredi Orthodox and Hasidic Orthodox Jews<b6_0/> are at best ambivalent towards the ideology of <a0_0>Zionism<a0_0/> and the creation of the <b9_0>State of Israel<b9_0/>, and there are many groups and organisations who are outspokenly anti-Zionistic, seeing the ideology of <b7_0>Zionism<b7_0/> as diametrically opposed to the teaching of the Torah, and the <a1_0>Zionist<a1_0/> administration of the State of Israel, with its emphasis on <a3_0><b8_0>militarism<a3_0/> and <a2_0>nationalism<b8_0/><a2_0/>, as <a4_0>destructive<a4_0/> of the Judaic way of life.
